main event: On February 7, 1956, at Lake Charles AFB, Louisiana, a pentagonal object with three bright spots was observed at approximately 30,000 ft. just after sunset. It was later concluded to be a balloon sighting.
interesting points: The object appeared to change from pentagonal to triangular in form with bright highlights at points.
A similar object was reported in the vicinity of Memphis and Meridian, adding to the mysterious nature of the sighting.
The observation lasted for 20 minutes, providing ample time for detailed assessment.
The description included details such as the condition of the sky, the position of the sun, and the visibility of stars and the moon.
Hand-drawn sketches labeled 'Changed to' and 'Cloud-like' depicted the observed object, revealing the witness's perception of its shape and motion.
